author: Times Now Digital
title: Captain Vijayakanth's Funeral: With Teary Eyes, People Pay Final Respects To Actor-Politician | India News, Times Now
text: Captain Vijayakanth's Funeral: With Teary Eyes, People Pay Final Respects To Actor-Politician Vijayakanth passed away on December 28 morning at 71. A huge crowd gathered at Koyambedu DMDK office in Chennai to pay final respects to the actor-politician. Vijayakanth passed away on December 28 morning at 71. Photo : Twitter Chennai: With tears in eyes and prayers in hearts, people paid final respects to Desiya Murpokku Dravida Kazhagam (DMDK) chief Vijayakanth at the Koyambedu DMDK office in Chennai. Vijayakanth passed away on December 28 morning at 71. The body of DMDK president and actor Vijayakanth was transported to Island Ground, Anna Salai on Friday morning. The remains were placed at Island Ground from 6 am to 1 pm to allow the public to bid their final farewell. Several celebrities, including actor Vijay and Rajinikanth showed up to pay their tribute to the late actor. Fondly referred to as 'Captain', Vijayakanth is known for his contribution to the Tamil film industry. Having appeared in 154 movies before entering politics, Vijayakanth made a significant impact in the South Indian film industry. In November, Vijayakanth was hospitalized at MIOT Hospital in Chennai due to a decline in his health. Experiencing symptoms of coughing and throat pain, he remained under medical observation for 14 days. PM Modi Condoles Vijayakanth's Demise Prime Minister Narendra Modi condoled the demise of Vijayakanth. In a post on X (formerly Twitter), PM Modi wrote, “Extremely saddened by the passing away of Thiru Vijayakanth Ji." “A legend of the Tamil film world, his charismatic performances captured the hearts of millions. As a political leader, he was deeply committed to public service, leaving a lasting impact on Tamil Nadu’s political landscape," the Prime Minister said. He added, “His passing leaves a void that will be hard to fill. He was a close friend and I fondly recall my interactions with him over the years. In this sad hour, my thoughts are with his family, fans and numerous followers. Om Shanti." Actor Vijayakanth was widely popular among people for his box-office blockbuster movies like Sattam Oru Iruttarai, Vallarasu, Ramana, Pulan Visaranai, Chatriyan, Chinna Gounder and Honest Raj. Vijayakanth earned the prefix ‘Captain’ after his 1991 super-hit film Captain Prabhakaran. [Latest News](https://www.timesnownews.com/latest-news) End of Article Subscribe to our daily Newsletter! author: 网易
title: 护宝寻踪：文雯被传唤，黎远光得知真相，燕小五松口，穆见晖完了_网易订阅
text:
《护宝寻踪》 黎远光 一直想弄明白 文雯 为什么要丢下他和孩子离开，即使自己被通缉他也冒险出去寻找文雯，只是恰好赶上 警察 找到了文雯。
穆见晖 亲口将真相告诉了黎远光
黎远光回来的路上遇见了穆见晖，回到宾馆穆见晖告诉他自己被刘树生作局和文雯发生了关系，黎远光听完直接怒了，他想去找刘树生算账，穆见晖自然要拦着他。
他要是去了，他们全都得抓进去，穆见晖直接跪下来求黎远光，以前穆见晖还是为自己积了太多的“德”，人心早就被收买了，即使再怎么愤怒黎远光看着跪在地上的“衣食父母”还是忍住了。
他抱着最后一丝希望问穆见晖，“亮亮是谁的？”穆见晖也挺有种的，“我的！”
黎远光的心碎了一地
黎远光终于明白文雯为什么离开了，只是不知道他会做出什么样的选择，但不管他揭不揭发穆见晖，穆见晖都会完了。
因为警察已经从 燕小五 这里找到了突破口，在牢里待了十年的燕小五出狱了，刚刚享受一家人在一起的美好时刻，却很快又被警察带走了。
燕小五坚持说是他倒卖的黑陶俑，然而当他的妻子和儿子抱着穆见晖十年来给他的堵口费。
儿子大声说出宁愿不上学也不花这些脏钱时，燕小五破防了，这十年的青春，还有他对家人的亏欠让他说出了真相。
正义的审判从不会缺席，再狡猾的狐狸也有露馅的时候
穆见晖自认为自己高段位的“兄弟情”能够堵住所有人的嘴，殊不知钱和兄弟情谊在亲情面前有时也会失效的，他太过于自信了！
图片来源于网络，侵权必删

author: ANI
title: At least 100 flights delayed due to fog at Delhi airport | Headlines
text: At least 100 flights delayed due to fog at Delhi airport At least 100 flights were delayed and a few were canceled due to low visibility at the Indira Gandhi International Airport in Delhi on Friday. [ANI](/ani-stories)| Updated: 29-12-2023 10:19 IST | Created: 29-12-2023 10:19 IST - Country: - India At least 100 flights were delayed and a few were canceled due to low visibility at the Indira Gandhi International Airport in Delhi on Friday. Airlines have requested passengers to keep a check on the status of flights on airline websites before leaving for the airport. Passengers who arrived at the airport but were not aware of the delays were seen sitting on the floors and waiting for an update from the airline. "I have been waiting for 12 hours at T-3 in the cold to catch a flight to Sharjah. The airline made no arrangements for passengers in case of delay in such weather," said Fakrool, a native of Rampur in UP. According to airport sources, visibility on Friday fell to 150 meters, which is considered moderate for flight operations. "No diversions have been reported till 8 am on Friday. There were several delays due to the weather and other conditions," as per sources. "I have a flight to Toronto, and it is delayed. I arrived at the airport in the morning from Punjab, and I am waiting for the update from the airline," said a passenger Kuldeep Singh, who was waiting with his family at IGI airport. Meanwhile, long queues of passengers at the entry gates of the Terminal were also seen. (ANI) (This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)

author: Yahoo Sports Commerce
title: Man admits to assaulting KDMC employees with colostomy contents
text:
The Daily Independent, Ashland, Ky. Man admits to assaulting KDMC employees with colostomy contents Mary Jane Epling, The Daily Independent, Ashland, Ky. December 28, 2023 at 10:46 PM · 2 min read Link Copied Read full article
Dec. 28—CATLETTSBURG — A 39-year-old man pleaded guilty on Thursday to multiple charges after throwing the contents of his colostomy bag at hospital workers last summer.
Joshua A. Potter, of an unknown address, was jailed following the incident at the King's Daughters emergency department in early July for reportedly attacking hospital workers with feces after ripping open his own colostomy bag, per previous reports.
Potter was indicted shortly thereafter on charges of third-degree assault on medical personnel, third-degree criminal mischief, trespassing and public intoxication.
On Thursday, Potter appeared via video conference from the Boyd County Detention Center to enter a guilty plea alongside his attorney, Whitney Davis.
Boyd Circuit Judge John Vincent said he was "particularly interested" in the details surrounding the third-degree assault charge before accepting the settled plea agreement between prosecutors and Davis.
"Well ..." Assistant Commonwealth's Attorney Kierston Rosen began before elaborating on the allegations against Potter.
Rosen said Potter attempted to throw "fecal matter" at hospital employees but added, "thankfully," no worker was hit by Potter's colostomy contents.
In exchange for Potter's admissions to third-degree assault, public intoxication and third-degree criminal mischief, the Commonwealth proposed to dismiss his charge of trespassing.
With the narrowly missed victims' and law enforcement's approval, Vincent accepted the plea arrangement and sentenced Potter according to the Commonwealth's suggestion.
Potter was sentenced to 90 days in jail for both public intoxication and criminal mischief (the maximum for both charges) and five years for third-degree assault on medical personnel.
In accordance with his plea arrangement, Potter will serve 180 days in jail and the remaining balance of the five-year sentence will be served under supervised probation.
One of the terms of his probation is to abide by Vincent's order to stay away from all KDMC properties, unless in a "dire medical emergency."
Vincent said if Potter violates any probation condition or trespasses on KDMC property, his probation could be revoked — meaning the five-year sentence would be served behind bars.
(606) 326-2652 —

author: @andaluciainf
title: La ola de calor remite pero siete comunidades siguen en alerta por las altas temperaturas | Andalucía Información. Todas las noticias de Cádiz
text: La ola de calor que durante los últimos días ha azotado a una gran parte del país ha remitido pero siete comunidades siguen hoy en alerta ante las elevadas temperaturas que se van a registrar durante las horas centrales del día y que volverán a rondar los 40 grados en muchos lugares. Las temperaturas van a volver a ser significativamente altas en la mitad sur de la península, en Cataluña y en el sur de la isla de Gran Canaria, según las predicciones de la Aemet, que ha avisado además de que se van a registrar lluvias importantes en la mitad noreste y de que van a ser especialmente fuertes en los Pirineos y en la cordillera Ibérica. Ante estas predicciones meteorológicas, se ha activado aviso "naranja" (riesgo importante) por las elevadas temperaturas en la comunidad de Andalucía, ya que los termómetros volverán a los 40 grados en muchos lugares de Almería y Málaga. El aviso amarillo (riesgo) se ha activado además en numerosos municipios de Andalucía, Baleares, Castilla-La Mancha, Cataluña, Murcia, la Comunidad Valenciana y Canarias (en la isla de Gran Canaria), ante la previsión de que los termómetros vuelvan a situarse en el entorno de los 40 grados. Además de las elevadas temperaturas, se han activado alertas también en Aragón, Cataluña, Castilla-La Mancha y Comunidad Valenciana ante las tormentas que se van a registrar a las horas centrales del día, que en muchos casos van a ir acompañadas de bolas de granizo de un tamaño grande y con rachas muy fuertes de viento. Las fuertes lluvias previstas también en muchos lugares a las horas centrales del día han justificado que se active la alerta "amarilla" (riesgo) en las comunidades de Aragón, Castilla-La Mancha, Cataluña y Comunidad Valenciana, y las precipitaciones llegarán a acumular 15 y 20 litros por metro cuadrado en una hora. El mapa de avisos meteorológicos previsto para hoy se completa con un aviso "amarillo" en Cataluña por el fuerte viento -de 50 a 60 kilómetros por hora- y el oleaje -con olas de hasta 3 metros- en la comarca de El Ampurdán (Girona), y con un aviso por risagas en la isla de Menorca. La risaga -una subida muy fuerte del nivel del mar- está prevista para las 19:00 horas de hoy en todo el litoral de la isla y las predicciones apuntan que provocará una subida del nivel del mar de 0,7 metros, según los datos de la Agencia Estatal de Meteorología. El mes de agosto comenzó con un primer día muy cálido en todo el país, y en el tercio sur se superaron ayer los 44 grados en algunos puntos, según información de la Aemet. Los termómetros registraron 44,3 grados en Álora (Málaga) y 44,1 en Alhama de Murcia. Durante la jornada de hoy se va a producir un alivio térmico en buena parte del territorio, aunque con calor en el tercio oriental peninsular, pero el fin de semana volverán a subir las temperaturas de forma casi generalizada. Envía tu noticia a: [participa@andaluciainformacion.es](mailto:participa@andaluciainformacion.es)

author: Warren Sears
title: FIRST WARN FORECAST: Quiet and cool weather for the next few days
text:
Happy New Year everyone! I hope you are all having a great start to 2024. It sure was nice to see the sun. Most of us stayed chilly in the mid to upper 30s for Monday highs. Monday evening will be cool and quiet. Overnight, lows drop to the mid-20s. We will try and add a few degrees for Tuesday afternoon with intervals of sun and clouds. Lower 40s for highs with a southwest wind turning out of the northwest in the afternoon. Dry and mostly sunny Wednesday near 40. Late this week, we are turning our attention to a few different storm systems.
Still, our confidence is low, but we could see a little bit of a wintry mix Friday into Friday night. No major travel impacts are expected as of now. Maybe a few flurries/showers Saturday and Sunday, but those days look mostly dry. Once we get into early next week, our data is suggesting a larger storm system. This could bring heavier rain and maybe even some snow. Still about a week out, so details are murky and location/track will change, but just wanted to give you an initial heads up that is something we are watching.

author: Victoria Félix
title: Nuevo León lidera homicidios en el país tras enfrentamiento en General Terán | MVS Noticias
text: Una jornada violenta se vivió ayer en Nuevo León con el enfrentamiento de elementos de Fuerza Civil y civiles armados que dejó un saldo de 11 personas abatidas en General Terán. Estos hechos colocaron al estado en el primer lugar en homicidios del país. De acuerdo con el reporte diario de homicidios dolosos generados emitido por la Secretaría de Seguridad y Protección Ciudadana (SSPC), este miércoles 25 de septiembre, Nuevo León reportó 14 homicidios, de los cuales 11 sucedieron en un solo enfrentamiento. En segundo lugar, se posicionó el Estado de México con 10 asesinatos, seguido por Guanajuato y Sinaloa empatados con 7 homicidios, respectivamente y Jalisco con 6. Estos fueron los estados que tuvieron más asesinatos en el país durante el día de ayer. Te podría interesar En lo que va de septiembre el estado ha registrado 127 homicidios. ¿Qué pasó en General Terán? En un operativo conjunto entre el Ejército Mexicano, la Guardia Nacional y Fuerza Civil, en menos de nueve horas, las autoridades aprehendieron a un hombre armado y abatieron a 11 delincuentes en el municipio de Los Ramones, Nuevo León. Te podría interesar El despliegue de inteligencia fue consecuencia de los hechos violentos ocurridos en General Terán, donde un grupo armado atacó la fachada de la Comandancia local a primeras horas de la mañana. El operativo incluyó patrullajes aéreos y terrestres en los municipios de General Terán, Los Ramones, Los Herrera y Cerralvo, con el objetivo de localizar a los responsables del ataque. Durante el rastreo en el Ejido "El Carrizo", en Los Ramones, fue detenido Alejandro “N”, de 30 años, quien portaba vestimenta camuflada, un arma larga y equipo táctico. El sospechoso fue interceptado mientras caminaba por la carretera en actitud sospechosa, lo que permitió su captura sin incidentes. Minutos después de la detención, los efectivos de las fuerzas de seguridad detectaron un convoy compuesto por aproximadamente ocho camionetas, tripuladas por hombres armados, que se desplazaban desde Cerralvo hacia Los Ramones. Ante la presencia de las autoridades, los delincuentes intentaron huir, lo que desató una persecución y un enfrentamiento armado.
